original: Bielke, Birgitta Marianne (Brita), grevinna. Sturefors, f. 5/9/95 i Fågel-tofta, Krist. 1., av kammarh. greve Carl Gustaf Sparre o. grev:an Alexandra S., f. Hamilton. G. 16 m. greve Thure Gabriel Bielke. Barn: Nils f. 17, Gunilla 19, Carl Gustaf 23, Catharina 30, Marianne 34. ■— Assumption-klostret i Köpenhamn 09-12, Carlo-witz Ursulinerkl. i Schlesien 12-13. Äg. gårdar i Skåne. Ordf. i Hane-kinds lok :fören. av fören. Östergötl. barn 21-40, led. av centr:styr. f. F. Ö. B. 20-47, v. ordf. fr. 44, ordf. f. kat. kvinnoförb., omb. f. De blindas väl, ordf. i Hanekinds mod. kvinnofören. 28-29. PåvlOPEetPO 33, FMM (Pro benign. hum.) 47.
translated: Bielke, Birgitta Marianne (Brita), Countess. Born on September 5th, 1895 in Fågeltifta, Kristianstad, daughter of Chamberlain Count Carl Gustaf Sparre and Countess Alexandra S. (Hamilton). Married Count Thure Gabriel Bielke in 1916. They had five children: Nils (born 1917), Gunilla (born 1919), Carl Gustaf (born 1923), Catharina (born 1930), and Marianne (born 1934). She was educated at Assumption Convent in Copenhagen from 1909 to 1912 and at Carlo-Witz Ursulinerkl. in Silesia in 1912-1913. Owned estates in Skåne. She served as chair of the Hane-kind local association of the East Gothland Children's Association from 1921 to 1940, member of the central board of the Swedish Child Welfare Association from 1920 to 1947, vice chair from 1944, chair of the Catholic Women's Association, representative of The Blind's Welfare Society, and chair of the modern women's association in Hanekind from 1928 to 1929. She was honored with the Papal Order of St. Pius X in 1933 and the Order of the French Sisters of St. Vincent de Paul in 1947 for her charitable work.

memberOf.name: Papal Order of St. Pius X
